story.text: NEW YORK Jan 3 Cruise company Carnival Corp. & Plc (CCL.N) (CCL.L) said on Wednesday it signed a letter of intent to buy a new 116,000-ton ship for its P&O Cruises brand at a cost of 535 million euros ($706 million). The new vessel, which will have 3,076 lower passenger berths, will be built by Italian shipbuilder Fincantieri and is scheduled for delivery in spring 2010, the company said. (1 euro = $1.32)
story.title: carnival plans new ship for 535 mln euros
